Developer/Integrations.title: Integrations
Developer/Integrations.description: Our Integration Guides are currently under construction and will be available soon.

Developer/Testing.title: Backend Testing
Developer/Testing.description: Tombolo uses Jest and Supertest for its testing framework. Jest provides a flexible environment for writing and running tests, while Supertest allows us to easily test our API endpoints. By combining these tools, we ensure our tests are both reliable and effective.

Install/Configurations.title: Configurations
Install/Configurations.description: To get Tombolo up and running, you'll need to configure two essential files. For your convenience, sample .env files are already included in the project. Simply copy these sample files and adjust the values to suit your specific environment.

Install/Docker.title: Docker Setup
Install/Docker.description: Tombolo can be deployed quickly by following a few simple steps and running a couple of Docker commands. With Docker, there are fewer prerequisites, and you donâ€™t need to worry about installing multiple applications or having a specific operating system on your machine. This makes Docker the preferred packaging method for production, as it ensures consistency across environments, enhances portability, and simplifies the deployment process.

Install/Local.title: Local Setup
Install/Local.description: Local installation requires a few dependencies to be installed directly on your machine. This is the best choice for developers who want to contribute to the project, or develop integrations to customize their instance. If you intend to use this installation for production purposes, or do not want to configure your own system, we recommend a containerized installation using our Docker Installation Guide instead.

Install/Uninstall.title: Uninstall Instructions
Install/Uninstall.description: There are three potential steps that need to be completed in order to remove Tombolo from your system. It is easiest to follow the order given here.

User-Guides/application.title: Applications
User-Guides/application.description: Applications provide a way to seperate groups of data and settings inside of Tombolo. Each application has its own set of Assets, Dataflows, Jobs, Monitorings, and Notifications as well as administration settings. You can switch application instances at any time by utilizing the selector in the top left corner of the navigation bar, by the Tombolo logo.

User-Guides/assets.title: Assets
User-Guides/assets.description: The "Add Asset" feature in Tombolo allows you to import assets and their metadata from an HPCC cluster. You can

User-Guides/cluster.title: Clusters
User-Guides/cluster.description: Tombolo can speak directly to HPCC clusters to run ECL code, monitor jobs, files, or cluster usage states, and schedule user-defined dataflows.

User-Guides/dashboards.title: Dashboards
User-Guides/dashboards.description: Our Dashboards give great insight into how you and your teams tasks are being handled. Tombolo currently offers two dashboards

User-Guides/github.title: Github
User-Guides/github.description: Adding a Github Repository will allow files in that repository to be utilized in Dataflows. Tombolo can utilize ECL code within files to execute ECL queries and workloads in the designated cluster.

User-Guides/monitoring/ClusterMonitoring.title: Cluster Monitoring
User-Guides/monitoring/ClusterMonitoring.description: Tombolo currently offers only one kind of monitoring for clusters, which is the ability to monitor if the engine(s) specified inside of the cluster exceed a usage percentage target.

User-Guides/monitoring/DirectoryMonitori.title: Directory Monitoring
User-Guides/monitoring/DirectoryMonitori.description: Directory monitoring in Tombolo enables tracking of files within the HPCC cluster, covering both Logical Files and Landing Zone Files. For logical files, you can monitor attributes like size, type, compression status, deletion, and protection status. For landing zone files, you can track file movement, appearance, and sizes, ensuring efficient management and visibility of your data

User-Guides/monitoring/jobMonitoring.title: Job Monitoring
User-Guides/monitoring/jobMonitoring.description: Job monitoring in Tombolo allows you to track Work Units (WU) running on HPCC clusters. Tombolo checks the clusters every 30 minutes and monitors work units based on a specified name or name pattern. It can send notifications if a work unit enters an undesired state, deviates from the expected state, or violates punctuality rules, such as failing to start or complete within the expected time.

User-Guides/monitoring/SuperFilesMonitor.title: Superfiles Monitoring
User-Guides/monitoring/SuperFilesMonitor.description: Superfiles are collections of files inside of an HPCC cluster, and can be thought of as similar to a folder inside of an operating system. Tombolo currently provides a few different monitoring paramters for these collections of files.

User-Guides/teams-webhook.title: MS Teams Webhooks
User-Guides/teams-webhook.description: Webhooks in Microsoft Teams allow Tombolo to deliver notifications and updates directly into a Teams channel. Webhooks post these updates directly into the chat stream which can be handled and responded to in order to keep your team on top of important notifications.

User-Guides/user-interface.title: User Interface
User-Guides/user-interface.description: Tombolo's user interface is divded into three major zones.

User-Guides/users.title: Users
User-Guides/users.description: Tombolo has a robust set of features that allow instance owners and admins to control who can access the instance, applications within the instance, and create, edit, view, or delete resources. We also offer two different methods for users to register their accounts depending on your team's desired configuration.

User-Guides/Wildcards.title: Wildcards
User-Guides/Wildcards.description: Wildcards are special characters that can stand in for unknown characters in a text value and are handy for

User-Guides/workflows.title: Workflows
User-Guides/workflows.description: Workflows are Tombolo's way of setting up a method for running a set of HPCC workunits, or jobs in a logical workflow.
